nodes.description: Paracetamol is used to treat mild to moderate pain and to reduce fever.
nodes.warnings: Do not exceed 4,000 milligrams of paracetamol per day.
nodes.how_to_use: Take this product by mouth as directed. Follow all directions on the product package.

nodes.description: Ibuprofen is used to reduce fever and treat pain or inflammation.
nodes.warnings: Long-term use can increase the risk of heart attack or stroke.
nodes.how_to_use: Take with a full glass of water. Do not lie down for at least 10 minutes after taking this medication.

nodes.description: Lisinopril is used to treat high blood pressure and heart failure.
nodes.warnings: Do not use if you are pregnant. It can cause injury or death to the unborn baby.
nodes.how_to_use: Take at the same time each day. Can be taken with or without food.

nodes.description: Paracetamol is used to relieve mild to moderate pain and reduce fever.
nodes.warnings: Avoid using more than the recommended dose to prevent liver damage.
nodes.dosage: 500mg every 4-6 hours as needed, not to exceed 4g per day.
nodes.how_to_use: Take orally with water, following the dosage instructions on the package.

nodes.description: Amoxicillin is used to treat a wide variety of bacterial infections.
nodes.warnings: Do not use if allergic to penicillin antibiotics.
nodes.dosage: 500mg every 8 hours, or as directed by your doctor.
nodes.how_to_use: Take by mouth with or without food. Continue to take it even if you feel well.
